column1: Number of freight train movements, impacts on road haulage and Freight Performance Measure: 2005/06-2011/12
Total number of freight trains movements
1 Figures have been sourced from Network Rail.
2 Measures the total number of train movements (including infrastructure trains) on the network.
3 The equivalent distance that road vehicles would need to have travelled to move the amounts of freight carried on rail, which is affected more by volume than
4 The equivalent number of road vehicle trips necessary to move this freight.
5 Data for 2011/12 will not be published until July 2013.
6 Percentage of trains arriving on time at their final destination. A train is considered 'on time' if it arrives within 10 minutes of its scheduled arrival time.
R Revisions have been made to the 2009/10 and 2010/11 number of freight train movements, 2008/09 and 2009/10 road vehicle journeys equivalent and 2010/11 FPM.

column8: Sources: Office of Rail Regulation (ORR); Network Rail

column1: The figures in this table are outside the scope of National Statistics
